availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jacob Adams (Morgan County, OH, farmer and inn keeper )

body.p: Morgan County, Ohio, farmer and innkeeper. Maryland native. Married to Amelia Adams. Father of Henry Adams, William Adams, Alfred Adams, Catherine Adams, and Jacob Adams. Farmer in Morgan County, Ohio, in 1850. Innkeeper in McConnelsville in 1860. Employed Peggy McAnelly and Mary Vanhorn as domestic servants in McConnelsville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Morgan County, Morgan Township, p. 229B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Morgan County, McConnelsville, p. 292.
"Jacob Adams (1788-1880)," Find A Grave, Memorial #6439999, accessed August 26, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6439999.
